file_content.text: ...station is working as planned, Grand Admiral. Not a single ship has gotten past us since the sensors went fully operational.
Not a single ship, hmm? So, it's just things right under your nose that you're blind to?
Sir? I assure you everything is under control. I have my best men guarding--
Had.
What are you doing here? I thought you were on the leash of that shrew Senator.
You've been following my career?
You know a lot about me.
There's hardly anything worth following. A minor underworld celebrity, now running errands at the Republic's beck and call.
I am the Voidwolf. I earned that name.
The Voidwolf, I presume?
Who are you?
Don't presume.
And don't imagine that discovering the stolen fortune of some wheezing old gangster--with his own daughter's aid--prepares you to take me on.
Okay, this is getting creepy. Do you have my picture on your wall?
What are you, a fan?
Go home, Captain. Make your jokes, revel in your ignorance.
I'm ready to take you on.
Then you haven't met anyone worth fearing.
Go home, Captain. Flash those smiles for your Republic broodmares.
Go home, Captain. You don't want to see what a slave collar makes women do.
Play the good dog and heel when your masters tell you. You're not ready to run with the wolves.
Wrong number.
Shut up. [Shoot comlink.]
No!
Your station's going down.
I'm here to stop you.
I--I won't let that happen, Grand Admiral. I--I'm summoning my support troops--
They're dead. Did you not figure that out?
This is the problem with Imperial training. They only learn one way to solve a problem.
I will bring her to you, sir, dead or in chains, anything you want.
I will bring you his head, sir. Him and everyone he came with.
I will not fail you!
